urls.title: Why Elon Musk Actually Bought Twitter - The Real Reason
urls.description: Twitter is a social media platform that allows users to send and read short messages called "tweets". Tweets are limited to 280 characters and can include te...

data.text:
Is this the real reason why Elon Musk bought Twitter?

https://t.co/pyuxMyDTl4

Marc _________ joining Tuesday! Pumped!! 

Now guess the person👇

All the above information was shared mainly by:

@nugenmediahub @NickPet57848042 

With additions from @CatskillCrypto 

For evidence and data, please reach out to them

Notes by the project:

- MFC is the first decentralized financial software, truly owned by its shareholders. Every transaction values the stock-like cryptocurrency, giving it stable and consistent growth.
- The funds generated from the Coin Offerings and Trading License are 👇

- We were told they (SBF, Kevin O'Leary & Justin Sun) were also creating a Layer 2 secondary payment system so inter-exchange transactions don't need to be settled on-chain. This would allow them to do what they did with FTX on a much bigger scale & get away with it (speculative)

Creating their own bank of international settlements for CBDCs

- This makes sense on why Kevin O'Leary is now vocal on stable coin regulation. 

- They had a plan to convince governments to make this happen.

- SBF has a LOT of money based on the data (billions)
- Point missed: SBF, Justin Sun and Kevin O'Leary were trying to crate their own stable coin system across multiple jurisdictions
Kevin: Canada
Justin: South Korea, Singapore & Vietnam (Huobi)
SBF: Japan, USA and Australia 👇

- FTX conglomerate political contributions are over $70m (proven) & were told that another $80m were donated secretly (unproven). That money was stolen from FTX users

- Data shows that FTX cashed out a lot of money for the Ukrainian Government (lot of public information on this)

- Dan is the mastermind of the Moonstone investment (speculation)

- Dan has experience in laundering money (speculative)

- Purpose was to replace Silvergate as FTX's fiat onboard and offboard, and we were told they intended to use Moonstone bank for washing money

- They intended to create their own stablecoin with Moonstone (speculative)

- We were told Alameda owned more than 10% of Moonstone (Dan got a controlling stake in the bank!). They lied that it's 10% on paper so regulators let it go through. They paid double the value (more info: https://t.co/4bWLn9UYck)

- Before the hack, we were told they were going into their systems to wipe data. The hack was likely a diversion to allow them to wipe their data. The "delete your FTX app" recommendation was NOT due to the hack but to wipe data

- We believe Caroline and SBF are working together to pretend this was all negligence and not intentional fraud

- Most of the US investors will be made whole on the back of international investors to avoid a long sentence in the states

- Other potential players: We were told dan friedberg reports to SBF's parents and Kevin O'Leary works closely with the parents (speculation/hearsay). SBF & Caroline report to Dan. Gary Wang & Nishad Singh report to SBF. Justin Sun and SBF talk directly.

- SBF destroyed projects that competed with similar projects he was supporting

- SBF, his family and employees spent a LOT more money ($500m) buying property then what was reported. Data also shows that it's very possible a lot more money laundering to FTX employees

- FTX's revenue structure was 2-fold:
1. Screwing over projects
2. Lying to investors and taking their money

Also note that FTX also forced projects to hold money Alameda invests in them on FTX

- FTX spent $13 billion and Alameda spent $13.5 billion based on our data modelling. We estimated they had over $26 billion spent (Figures 10% off)

- Once we got FTX's revenue model, things kept looking worse and worse and further confirmed the fake volume speculation.

- 75-95% of FTX's volume was fake to boost their valuation, to boost the value of FTT, to charge projects more to list, get more clients for market making and boost their valuation

- "Fiat was being exited from the system while the artificial show was going on"

- FTX, Kevin O'leary & Justin Sun were working on a joint liquidity pool for all their exchanges, and were looking at becoming the predominant exchange for CBDCs (which dwarfs the current crypto market). This would allow them to counterfeit the CBDCs of any country (Speculative)

- The next day, all the fake tokens were completely wiped from our Liquid account.

- We then spoke to Liquid, and they said that Alameda requested for the transaction to be reversed (wiping the data of the fake tokens they sent them)

- We requested our coins back from Alameda, instead they kept dumping our token (NuCoin). They then returned a small number of coins, and our AI found out these were fake coins. They sent the tokens to a Liquid wallet (to allow them to send fake tokens) rather than our wallet

- Alameda was given Tether in 2017 for "market making",  and that tether was used for various market manipulations. 

- When we went to Alameda re the dump of our token, Alameda blamed Liquid, and Liquid blamed Alameda.

- Dan's background is shady to say the least (Ultimate Bets poker fraud)

- A lot of what we saw in the FTX model was very similar to what Dan did with Ultimate Bets, a "parallel". Alameda had an exemption, seeing all the data and manipulating the market on the back of clients

- We complained to Caroline directly, and she was not "intellectually competent" to understand and she forwarded the inquiry to Daniel Friedberg

- Dan is a significant stakeholder and a much bigger player in the FTX collapse, and not only a chief compliance officer

- We got screwed on Japan's Liquid Exchange (owned by FTX), and since we have superior tech with our sophisticated AI, this triggered our investigation

- Alameda dumped our tokens that were meant for market making instead of sustaining our price

🚨FINAL revelations on FTX now live on stage. Results from multi-month investigation

Writing the thread as I listen to the whistleblowers now on the space 👇
Do you think it's possible Sam Bankman-Fried does NOT go to jail?
